so definite that it _carried_ the room, if you see what I mean...
supposing we covered the walls with white chromium plating and had
natural sheepskin carpet... I wonder if that would be running you in
for more than you meant to spend?
subQuotationList:
['I know exactly what Brenda wants,', "I
don't think it will be impossible. I must think about it. As Veronica
says, the structure does rather limit one... you know, I think the only
thing to do would be to disregard it altogether and find some treatment
so definite that it _carried_ the room, if you see what I mean...
supposing we covered the walls with white chromium plating and had
natural sheepskin carpet... I wonder if that would be running you in
for more than you meant to spend?"]
speaker: Mrs. Beaver

quoteText: I'd blow the whole thing sky-high,
subQuotationList: ["I'd blow the whole thing sky-high,"]
speaker: Veronica

quoteText: D'you really want Mrs Beaver to do up the morning-room?
subQuotationList: ["D'you really want Mrs Beaver to do up the morning-room?"]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Not if you don't, sweet.
subQuotationList: ["Not if you don't, sweet."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: But can you imagine it--white chromium plating?
subQuotationList: ['But can you imagine it--white chromium plating?']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Oh, that was just an idea.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, that was just an idea.']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: I say, You aren't going away to-morrow too, are you?
subQuotationList: ['I say,', "You aren't going away to-morrow too, are you?"]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Must.
subQuotationList: ['Must.']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText:
By the way, what did you think about keeping on
Grimshawe?--it seems rather a waste.
subQuotationList: ['By the way,', 'what did you think about keeping on\nGrimshawe?--it seems rather a waste.']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: You used always to say you couldn't get on without her.
subQuotationList: ["You used always to say you couldn't get on without her."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Yes, but now I'm living at the flat everything's so simple.
subQuotationList: ["Yes, but now I'm living at the flat everything's so simple."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: _Living?_ Darling, you talk as though you had settled there for good.
subQuotationList: ['_Living?_ Darling, you talk as though you had settled there for good.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: D'you mind moving a second, sweet? I can't see properly.
subQuotationList: ["D'you mind moving a second, sweet? I can't see properly."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Brenda, how long are you going on with this course of economics?
subQuotationList: ['Brenda, how long are you going on with this course of economics?']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Me? I don't know.
subQuotationList: ["Me? I don't know."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: But you must have some idea?
subQuotationList: ['But you must have some idea?']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
Oh, it's surprising what a lot there is to learn... I was so backward
when I started...
subQuotationList: ["Oh, it's surprising what a lot there is to learn... I was so backward\nwhen I started..."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Brenda...
subQuotationList: ['Brenda...']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
Now run and put on your coat. They'll all be downstairs waiting for
us.
subQuotationList: ["Now run and put on your coat. They'll all be downstairs waiting for\nus."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText:
Why, Tony, Why,
Tony, I was almost asleep.
subQuotationList: ['Why, Tony,', 'Why,\nTony,', 'I was almost asleep.']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Very tired?
subQuotationList: ['Very tired?']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Mm.
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Want to be left alone?
subQuotationList: ['Want to be left alone?']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: So tired... and I've just drunk a lot of that stuff of Polly's.
subQuotationList: ["So tired... and I've just drunk a lot of that stuff of Polly's."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: I see... well, good night.
subQuotationList: ['I see... well, good night.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Good night... don't mind, do you?... so tired.
subQuotationList: ["Good night... don't mind, do you?... so tired."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Lady Brenda not ill, I hope?
subQuotationList: ['Lady Brenda not ill, I hope?']
speaker: The Vicar

quoteText:
No, nothing serious, thank you very much. She gets rather done up in
London, you know, during the week, and likes to take Sunday quietly.
subQuotationList: ['No, nothing serious, thank you very much. She gets rather done up in\nLondon, you know, during the week, and likes to take Sunday quietly.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: And how are the great studies progressing?
subQuotationList: ['And how are the great studies progressing?']
speaker: The Vicar

quoteText: Very well, I gather. She seems keen on it still.
subQuotationList: ['Very well, I gather. She seems keen on it still.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
Splendid. We shall all be coming to her soon to solve our economic
problems. But I daresay you and John miss her?
subQuotationList: ['Splendid. We shall all be coming to her soon to solve our economic\nproblems. But I daresay you and John miss her?']
speaker: The Vicar

quoteText: Yes, we do rather.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, we do rather.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Well, please give her my kindest regards.
subQuotationList: ['Well, please give her my kindest regards.']
speaker: The Vicar

quoteText: I will indeed. Thank you so much.
subQuotationList: ['I will indeed. Thank you so much.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
Come in, darling, it isn't anything. It's only we had a bet on what
coloured buttonhole you'd be wearing and none of us won.
subQuotationList: ["Come in, darling, it isn't anything. It's only we had a bet on what\ncoloured buttonhole you'd be wearing and none of us won."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText:
Any time you are buying cuttings
or seeds do get them through me. I've made quite a little business of
it, perhaps you didn't know... all kinds of rather unusual flowers. I
do everything like that for Sylvia Newport and all sorts of people.
subQuotationList:
["Any time you are buying cuttings
or seeds do get them through me. I've made quite a little business of
it, perhaps you didn't know... all kinds of rather unusual flowers. I
do everything like that for Sylvia Newport and all sorts of people."]
speaker: Mrs. Beaver

quoteText: You must talk to my head man about it.
subQuotationList: ['You must talk to my head man about it.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
Well, to tell you the truth I _have_--this morning while you were in
church. He seems quite to understand.
subQuotationList: ['Well, to tell you the truth I _have_--this morning while you were in\nchurch. He seems quite to understand.']
speaker: Mrs. Beaver

quoteText: Golly, what a house.
subQuotationList: ['Golly, what a house.']
speaker: Daisy

quoteText: Now you can see what I've been through all these years.
subQuotationList: ["Now you can see what I've been through all these years."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: My poor Brenda,
subQuotationList: ['My poor Brenda,']
speaker: Veronica

quoteText:
You know, I'm not _absolutely_ happy about
Tony.
subQuotationList: ['You know,', "I'm not _absolutely_ happy about\nTony."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: What's the old boy been up to?
subQuotationList: ["What's the old boy been up to?"]
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

quoteText:
Nothing much yet, but I do see it's pretty boring for him at Hetton all
this time.
subQuotationList: ["Nothing much yet, but I do see it's pretty boring for him at Hetton all\nthis time."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: I shouldn't worry.
subQuotationList: ["I shouldn't worry."]
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

quoteText:
Oh, I'm not _worrying_. It's only, supposing he took to drink or
something. It would make everything very difficult.
subQuotationList: ["Oh, I'm not _worrying_. It's only, supposing he took to drink or\nsomething. It would make everything very difficult."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText:
I shouldn't have said that was his thing... We must get him interested
in a girl.
subQuotationList: ["I shouldn't have said that was his thing... We must get him interested\nin a girl."]
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

quoteText: If only we could... Who is there?
subQuotationList: ['If only we could... Who is there?']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: There's always old Sybil.
subQuotationList: ["There's always old Sybil."]
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

quoteText: Darling, he's known her all his life.
subQuotationList: ["Darling, he's known her all his life."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Or Souki de Foucauld-Esterhazy.
subQuotationList: ['Or Souki de Foucauld-Esterhazy.']
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

quoteText: He isn't his best with Americans.
subQuotationList: ["He isn't his best with Americans."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Well, we'll find him someone.
subQuotationList: ["Well, we'll find him someone."]
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

quoteText:
The trouble is that I've become such a habit with him--he won't take
easily to a new one... ought she to be like me, or quite different?
subQuotationList: ["The trouble is that I've become such a habit with him--he won't take\neasily to a new one... ought she to be like me, or quite different?"]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: I'd say different, but it's hard to tell.
subQuotationList: ["I'd say different, but it's hard to tell."]
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

quoteText: Are you _certain_ Jenny will be Tony's tea?
subQuotationList: ["Are you _certain_ Jenny will be Tony's tea?"]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText:
You can't ever be certain, She bores my pants off, but
she's a good trier.
subQuotationList: ["You can't ever be certain,", "She bores my pants off, but\nshe's a good trier."]
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

quoteText: Is mummy coming down to-day, daddy?
subQuotationList: ['Is mummy coming down to-day, daddy?']
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: Yes.
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Who else?
subQuotationList: ['Who else?']
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: Someone called Jenny Abdul Akbar.
subQuotationList: ['Someone called Jenny Abdul Akbar.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: What a silly name. Is she foreign?
subQuotationList: ['What a silly name. Is she foreign?']
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: I don't know.
subQuotationList: ["I don't know."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
Sounds foreign, doesn't she, daddy? D'you think she won't be able to
talk any English? Is she black?
subQuotationList: ["Sounds foreign, doesn't she, daddy? D'you think she won't be able to\ntalk any English? Is she black?"]
speaker: John Andrew
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Tony Last'], ['Tony Last'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar']]]

quoteText: Mummy says not.
subQuotationList: ['Mummy says not.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Oh... who else?
subQuotationList: ['Oh... who else?']
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: Lady Cockpurse.
subQuotationList: ['Lady Cockpurse.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
The monkey-woman. You know she wasn't a bit like a monkey except
perhaps her face and I don't think she had a tail because I looked as
close as anything... unless perhaps she has it rolled up between her
legs. D'you think she has, daddy?
subQuotationList:
["The monkey-woman. You know she wasn't a bit like a monkey except
perhaps her face and I don't think she had a tail because I looked as
close as anything... unless perhaps she has it rolled up between her
legs. D'you think she has, daddy?"]
speaker: John Andrew
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Polly Cockpurse'], ['Tony Last'], ['Polly Cockpurse'], ['Polly Cockpurse'], ['Polly Cockpurse'], ['Polly Cockpurse'], ['Polly'], ['Tony Last'], ['Polly Cockpurse'], ['Tony Last']]]

quoteText: I shouldn't be surprised.
subQuotationList: ["I shouldn't be surprised."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: _Very_ uncomfortable.
subQuotationList: ['_Very_ uncomfortable.']
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText:
Give
the girl a chance to get down to it,
subQuotationList: ['Give\nthe girl a chance to get down to it,']
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

quoteText: Princess Abdul Akbar.
subQuotationList: ['Princess Abdul Akbar.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Oh, Mr Last, what a sweet old place this is.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, Mr Last,', 'what a sweet old place this is.']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: I'm afraid it's been restored a great deal,
subQuotationList: ["I'm afraid it's been restored a great deal,"]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
Ah, but its _atmosphere_. I always think that's what counts in a house.
Such dignity, and repose. But of course you're used to it. When you've
been very unhappy as I have, you appreciate these things.
subQuotationList: ["Ah, but its _atmosphere_. I always think that's what counts in a house.\nSuch dignity, and repose. But of course you're used to it. When you've\nbeen very unhappy as I have, you appreciate these things."]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText:
I'm afraid Brenda hasn't arrived yet. She's coming by car
with Lady Cockpurse.
subQuotationList: ["I'm afraid Brenda hasn't arrived yet. She's coming by car\nwith Lady Cockpurse."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Brenda's been _such_ a friend to me.
subQuotationList: ["Brenda's been _such_ a friend to me."]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText:
D'you
mind if I take off my hat?
subQuotationList: ["D'you\nmind if I take off my hat?"]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: No, no... of course.
subQuotationList: ['No, no... of course.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
D'you know, Mr Last, I'm going to call you Teddy right
away. You don't think that very fresh of me? And you must call me Jenny.
"Princess" is so formal, isn't it, and suggests tight trousers and gold
braid... Of course my husband
was not called "Prince" in Morocco; his title was Moulay--but there's no
proper equivalent for a woman, so I've always called myself Princess in
Europe... Moulay is _far_ higher really... my husband was a descendant
of the Prophet. Are you interested in the East?
subQuotationList:
['D'you know, Mr Last, I'm going to call you Teddy right
away. You don't think that very fresh of me? And you must call me Jenny.
"Princess" is so formal, isn't it, and suggests tight trousers and gold
braid... Of course', 'my husband
was not called "Prince" in Morocco; his title was Moulay--but there's no
proper equivalent for a woman, so I've always called myself Princess in
Europe... Moulay is _far_ higher really... my husband was a descendant
of the Prophet. Are you interested in the East?']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Tony Last'], ['Tony Last'], ['Tony Last'], ['Tony'], ['Tony Last'], ['Tony Last'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar']], [['Moulay'], ['Moulay'], ['Moulay'], ['Tony Last']]]

quoteText: No... yes. I mean I know very little about it.
subQuotationList: ['No... yes. I mean I know very little about it.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
It has an uncanny fascination for me. You must go there, Teddy. I know
you'd like it. I've been saying the same to Brenda.
subQuotationList: ["It has an uncanny fascination for me. You must go there, Teddy. I know\nyou'd like it. I've been saying the same to Brenda."]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText:
I expect you'd like to see your room, They'll bring tea
soon.
subQuotationList: ["I expect you'd like to see your room,", "They'll bring tea\nsoon."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
No, I'll stay here. I like just to curl up like a cat in front of the
fire, and if you're nice to me I'll purr, and if you're cruel I shall
pretend not to notice--just like a cat... Shall I purr, Teddy?
subQuotationList: ["No, I'll stay here. I like just to curl up like a cat in front of the\nfire, and if you're nice to me I'll purr, and if you're cruel I shall\npretend not to notice--just like a cat... Shall I purr, Teddy?"]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: Er... yes... do, please, if that's what you like doing.
subQuotationList: ["Er... yes... do, please, if that's what you like doing."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
Englishmen are so gentle and considerate. It's wonderful to be back
among them... mine own people. Sometimes when I look back at my life,
especially at times like this, among lovely old English things and kind
people, I think the whole thing must be a frightful nightmare... then I
remember my _scars_...
subQuotationList:
["Englishmen are so gentle and considerate. It's wonderful to be back
among them... mine own people. Sometimes when I look back at my life,
especially at times like this, among lovely old English things and kind
people, I think the whole thing must be a frightful nightmare... then I
remember my _scars_..."]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText:
Brenda tells me you've taken one of the flats in the same house as
hers. They must be very convenient.
subQuotationList: ["Brenda tells me you've taken one of the flats in the same house as\nhers. They must be very convenient."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
How English you are, Teddy--so shy of talking about personal things,
intimate things... I like you for that, you know. I love everything
that's solid and homely and _good_ after... after all I've been
through.
subQuotationList:
["How English you are, Teddy--so shy of talking about personal things,
intimate things... I like you for that, you know. I love everything
that's solid and homely and _good_ after... after all I've been
through."]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: You're not studying economics too, are you, like Brenda?
subQuotationList: ["You're not studying economics too, are you, like Brenda?"]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
No; is Brenda? She never told me. What a wonderful person she is. When
_does_ she find the time?
subQuotationList: ['No; is Brenda? She never told me. What a wonderful person she is. When\n_does_ she find the time?']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText:
Ah, here comes tea at last, I hope you allow yourself to
eat muffins. So many of our guests nowadays are on a diet. I think
muffins one of the few things that make the English winter endurable.
subQuotationList: ['Ah, here comes tea at last,', 'I hope you allow yourself to\neat muffins. So many of our guests nowadays are on a diet. I think\nmuffins one of the few things that make the English winter endurable.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Muffins stand for so much,
subQuotationList: ['Muffins stand for so much,']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: Come and be introduced to Princess Abdul Akbar.
subQuotationList: ['Come and be introduced to Princess Abdul Akbar.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Aren't you going to give me a kiss?
subQuotationList: ["Aren't you going to give me a kiss?"]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: Oh, What a beautiful smell.
subQuotationList: ['Oh,', 'What a beautiful smell.']
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: It's my last link with the East,
subQuotationList: ["It's my last link with the East,"]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: You've got butter on your chin.
subQuotationList: ["You've got butter on your chin."]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText:
Why, so I have. Teddy, you _might_
have told me.
subQuotationList: ['Why, so I have. Teddy, you _might_\nhave told me.']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: Why do you call daddy Teddy?
subQuotationList: ['Why do you call daddy Teddy?']
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: Because I hope we are going to be great friends.
subQuotationList: ['Because I hope we are going to be great friends.']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: What a funny reason.
subQuotationList: ['What a funny reason.']
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText:
Have you got a crown? How did you learn to speak English?
What is that big ring made of? Did it cost much? Why are your nails that
colour? Can you ride?
subQuotationList: ['Have you got a crown?', 'How did you learn to speak English?\nWhat is that big ring made of? Did it cost much? Why are your nails that\ncolour? Can you ride?']
speaker: John Andrew
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Jenny Abdul Akbar']], [['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar']]]

quoteText: That is my only crown... now,
subQuotationList: ['That is my only crown... now,']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: On the Moulay's birthday--
subQuotationList: ["On the Moulay's birthday--"]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: What's the Moulay?
subQuotationList: ["What's the Moulay?"]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText:
A beautiful and a very bad man, and on his birthday
all his horsemen used to assemble round a great square, with all their
finest clothes and trappings and jewels, with long swords in their
hands. The Moulay used to sit on a throne under a great crimson canopy.
subQuotationList:
['A beautiful and a very bad man,', 'and on his birthday
all his horsemen used to assemble round a great square, with all their
finest clothes and trappings and jewels, with long swords in their
hands. The Moulay used to sit on a throne under a great crimson canopy.']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: What's a canopy?
subQuotationList: ["What's a canopy?"]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText:
Like a tent, and all the horsemen used to gallop across the plain, in a great cloud
of dust, waving their swords, straight towards the Moulay. And everyone
used to hold their breath, thinking the horsemen were bound to ride
right on top of the Moulay, but when they were a few feet away, as near
as I am to you, galloping at full speed, they used to rein their horses
back, up on to their hind legs and salute--
subQuotationList:
['Like a tent,', 'and all the horsemen used to gallop across the plain, in a great cloud
of dust, waving their swords, straight towards the Moulay. And everyone
used to hold their breath, thinking the horsemen were bound to ride
right on top of the Moulay, but when they were a few feet away, as near
as I am to you, galloping at full speed, they used to rein their horses
back, up on to their hind legs and salute--']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText:
Oh, but they _shouldn't_, It's _very_ bad horsemanship
indeed. Ben says so.
subQuotationList: ["Oh, but they _shouldn't_,", "It's _very_ bad horsemanship\nindeed. Ben says so."]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: They're the most wonderful horsemen in the world. Everyone knows that.
subQuotationList: ["They're the most wonderful horsemen in the world. Everyone knows that."]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText:
Oh, no, they can't be, if they do _that_. It's one of the _worst_
things. Were they natives?
subQuotationList: ["Oh, no, they can't be, if they do _that_. It's one of the _worst_\nthings. Were they natives?"]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: Yes, of course.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, of course.']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: Ben says natives aren't humans at all really.
subQuotationList: ["Ben says natives aren't humans at all really."]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText:
Ah, but he's thinking of Negroes, I expect. These are pure Semitic
type.
subQuotationList: ["Ah, but he's thinking of Negroes, I expect. These are pure Semitic\ntype."]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: What's that?
subQuotationList: ["What's that?"]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: The same as Jews.
subQuotationList: ['The same as Jews.']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: Ben says Jews are worse than natives.
subQuotationList: ['Ben says Jews are worse than natives.']
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText:
Oh dear, what a very severe boy you are. I was like that once. Life
teaches one to be tolerant.
subQuotationList: ['Oh dear, what a very severe boy you are. I was like that once. Life\nteaches one to be tolerant.']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText:
It hasn't taught Ben, When's mummy coming? I thought she'd
be here, otherwise I wouldn't have stopped painting my picture.
subQuotationList: ["It hasn't taught Ben,", "When's mummy coming? I thought she'd\nbe here, otherwise I wouldn't have stopped painting my picture."]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: Good night, Johnny-boy,
subQuotationList: ['Good night, Johnny-boy,']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: What did you call me?
subQuotationList: ['What did you call me?']
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: Johnny-boy.
subQuotationList: ['Johnny-boy.']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: You are funny with names.
subQuotationList: ['You are funny with names.']
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: Nanny, I do think that Princess is beautiful, don't you?
subQuotationList: ["Nanny, I do think that Princess is beautiful, don't you?"]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: It would be a dull world if we all thought alike,
subQuotationList: ['It would be a dull world if we all thought alike,']
speaker: Nanny

quoteText:
She's more beautiful than Miss Tendril, even. I think she's the most
beautiful lady I've ever seen... D'you think she'd like to watch me
have my bath?
subQuotationList: ["She's more beautiful than Miss Tendril, even. I think she's the most\nbeautiful lady I've ever seen... D'you think she'd like to watch me\nhave my bath?"]
speaker: John Andrew
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Miss Tendril'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Nanny'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar']]]

quoteText:
What a heavenly child... I love children. That
has been my great tragedy. It was when he found I couldn't have children
that the Moulay first showed the Other Side of his Nature. It wasn't my
fault... you see my womb is out of place... I don't know why I'm
telling you all this, but I feel you'll understand. It's such a _waste
of time_, isn't it, when one knows one is going to like someone and one
goes on _pretending_... I know at once if someone is going to be a real
friend...
subQuotationList:
["What a heavenly child... I love children. That
has been my great tragedy. It was when he found I couldn't have children
that the Moulay first showed the Other Side of his Nature. It wasn't my
fault... you see my womb is out of place... I don't know why I'm
telling you all this, but I feel you'll understand. It's such a _waste
of time_, isn't it, when one knows one is going to like someone and one
goes on _pretending_... I know at once if someone is going to be a real
friend..."]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText:
Oh, mummy, there's such a beautiful lady
downstairs. Do ask her to come and say good night. Nanny doesn't think
she'd want to.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, mummy,', "there's such a beautiful lady\ndownstairs. Do ask her to come and say good night. Nanny doesn't think\nshe'd want to."]
speaker: John Andrew
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Brenda']], [['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Nanny'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar']]]

quoteText: Did daddy seem to like her?
subQuotationList: ['Did daddy seem to like her?']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText:
He didn't talk much... She doesn't know anything about horses or
natives but she _is_ beautiful. Please tell her to come up.
subQuotationList: ["He didn't talk much... She doesn't know anything about horses or\nnatives but she _is_ beautiful. Please tell her to come up."]
speaker: John Andrew
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Tony Last'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar']]]

quoteText:
You've made a wild success with John Andrew. He won't go
to sleep until he's seen you again.
subQuotationList: ["You've made a wild success with John Andrew. He won't go\nto sleep until he's seen you again."]
speaker: Brenda
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['John Andrew'], ['John Andrew'], ['John Andrew'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar']]]

quoteText: They're both such dears.
subQuotationList: ["They're both such dears."]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText:
Did you and Tony get on? I was so sorry not to be here when you
arrived.
subQuotationList: ['Did you and Tony get on? I was so sorry not to be here when you\narrived.']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: He was _so_ sympathetic and gentle... and so wistful.
subQuotationList: ['He was _so_ sympathetic and gentle... and so wistful.']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: Back to bed, or I shall spank you.
subQuotationList: ['Back to bed,', 'or I shall spank you.']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: Would you do it hard? I shouldn't mind.
subQuotationList: ["Would you do it hard? I shouldn't mind."]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText:
Oh dear, what a terrible effect you seem to have. He's
never like this as a rule.
subQuotationList: ['Oh dear,', "what a terrible effect you seem to have. He's\nnever like this as a rule."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Poof! making the whole place stink.
subQuotationList: ['Poof!', 'making the whole place stink.']
speaker: Nanny

quoteText: Don't you like it? _I_ think it's lovely.
subQuotationList: ["Don't you like it? _I_ think it's lovely."]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: How's it going?
subQuotationList: ["How's it going?"]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Too soon to tell. I'm sure it will be all right.
subQuotationList: ["Too soon to tell. I'm sure it will be all right."]
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

quoteText:
She's got the wrong chap. John Andrew's mad about her... quite
embarrassing.
subQuotationList: ["She's got the wrong chap. John Andrew's mad about her... quite\nembarrassing."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText:
I should say Tony was a slow starter. It's a pity she's got his name
wrong. Ought we to tell her?
subQuotationList: ["I should say Tony was a slow starter. It's a pity she's got his name\nwrong. Ought we to tell her?"]
speaker: Polly Cockpurse
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Tony Last'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Tony Last'], ['Brenda', 'Polly Cockpurse'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar']]]

quoteText: No, let's leave it.
subQuotationList: ["No, let's leave it."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Brenda, who _is_ this joke-woman?
subQuotationList: ['Brenda, who _is_ this joke-woman?']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Darling, don't you like her?
subQuotationList: ["Darling, don't you like her?"]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText:
I don't know about not liking her exactly. She's just a joke,
isn't she?
subQuotationList: ["I don't know about not liking her exactly. She's just a joke,\nisn't she?"]
speaker: Tony Last
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar']]]

quoteText: Is she... oh dear... She's had a terrible life, you know.
subQuotationList: ["Is she... oh dear... She's had a terrible life, you know."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: So I gathered.
subQuotationList: ['So I gathered.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Be nice to her, Tony, please.
subQuotationList: ['Be nice to her, Tony, please.']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Oh, I'll be nice to her. Is she a Jewess?
subQuotationList: ["Oh, I'll be nice to her. Is she a Jewess?"]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: I don't know. I never thought. Perhaps she is.
subQuotationList: ["I don't know. I never thought. Perhaps she is."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Leave the young couple to it,
subQuotationList: ['Leave the young couple to it,']
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

quoteText:
My dear, I don't believe it's going to be any good... the poor old
boy's got _some_ taste you know, and a sense of humour.
subQuotationList: ["My dear, I don't believe it's going to be any good... the poor old\nboy's got _some_ taste you know, and a sense of humour."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: She didn't show up too well at dinner, did she?
subQuotationList: ["She didn't show up too well at dinner, did she?"]
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

quoteText:
She will _go on_ so... and, after all, Tony's been used to me for
seven years. It's rather a sudden change.
subQuotationList: ["She will _go on_ so... and, after all, Tony's been used to me for\nseven years. It's rather a sudden change."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Tired?
subQuotationList: ['Tired?']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Mmm. Little bit.
subQuotationList: ['Mmm. Little bit.']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: You gave me a pretty long bout of Abdul Akbar.
subQuotationList: ['You gave me a pretty long bout of Abdul Akbar.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
I know. I'm sorry, darling, but Polly takes so long to get to bed...
Was it awful? I wish you liked her more.
subQuotationList: ["I know. I'm sorry, darling, but Polly takes so long to get to bed...\nWas it awful? I wish you liked her more."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: She's awful.
subQuotationList: ["She's awful."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: One has to make allowances... she's got the most terrible scars.
subQuotationList: ["One has to make allowances... she's got the most terrible scars."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: So she told me.
subQuotationList: ['So she told me.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: I've seen them.
subQuotationList: ["I've seen them."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Besides, I hoped to see something of you.
subQuotationList: ['Besides, I hoped to see something of you.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Oh.
speaker: Brenda

quoteText:
Brenda, you aren't angry still about my getting tight that night and
waking you up?
subQuotationList: ["Brenda, you aren't angry still about my getting tight that night and\nwaking you up?"]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: No, sweet, do I seem angry?
subQuotationList: ['No, sweet, do I seem angry?']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: ...I don't know. You do rather... Has it been an amusing week?
subQuotationList: ["...I don't know. You do rather... Has it been an amusing week?"]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Not amusing, very hard work. Bimetallism, you know.
subQuotationList: ['Not amusing, very hard work. Bimetallism, you know.']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Oh, yes... well, I suppose you want to go to sleep.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, yes... well, I suppose you want to go to sleep.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Mm... so tired. Good night, darling.
subQuotationList: ['Mm... so tired. Good night, darling.']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Good night.
subQuotationList: ['Good night.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Can I go and say good morning to the Princess, mummy?
subQuotationList: ['Can I go and say good morning to the Princess, mummy?']
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: I don't expect she's awake yet.
subQuotationList: ["I don't expect she's awake yet."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText:
Please, mummy, may I go and see? I'll just peep and, if she's asleep,
go away.
subQuotationList: ["Please, mummy, may I go and see? I'll just peep and, if she's asleep,\ngo away."]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: I don't know what room she's in.
subQuotationList: ["I don't know what room she's in."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Galahad, my lady,
subQuotationList: ['Galahad, my lady,']
speaker: Grimshawe

quoteText: Oh dear, why was she put there?
subQuotationList: ['Oh dear, why was she put there?']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: It was Mr Last's orders, my lady.
subQuotationList: ["It was Mr Last's orders, my lady."]
speaker: Grimshawe

quoteText: Well, she's probably awake, then.
subQuotationList: ["Well, she's probably awake, then."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: May I come in?
subQuotationList: ['May I come in?']
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: Hullo, Johnny-boy. Come in.
subQuotationList: ['Hullo, Johnny-boy. Come in.']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: Have you had breakfast? Mummy said you wouldn't be awake.
subQuotationList: ["Have you had breakfast? Mummy said you wouldn't be awake."]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText:
I've been awake a long time. You see I was once very badly hurt, and
now I don't always sleep well. Even the softest beds are too hard for me
now.
subQuotationList: ["I've been awake a long time. You see I was once very badly hurt, and\nnow I don't always sleep well. Even the softest beds are too hard for me\nnow."]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: Ooh. What did you do? Was it a motor-car accident?
subQuotationList: ['Ooh. What did you do? Was it a motor-car accident?']
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText:
Not an accident, Johnny-boy, not an accident... but come in. It's cold
with the door open. Look, there are some grapes here. Would you like to
eat them?
subQuotationList: ["Not an accident, Johnny-boy, not an accident... but come in. It's cold\nwith the door open. Look, there are some grapes here. Would you like to\neat them?"]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: What are you going to do to-day?
subQuotationList: ['What are you going to do to-day?']
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: I don't know yet. I haven't been told.
subQuotationList: ["I don't know yet. I haven't been told."]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText:
Well, I'll tell you. We'll go to church in the morning because I have
to and then we'll go and look at Thunderclap and I'll show you the place
we jump and then you can come with me while I have dinner because I have
it early and afterwards we can go down to Bruton Wood and we needn't
take nanny because it makes her so muddy and you can see where they dug
out a fox in the drain just outside the wood, he nearly got away, and
then you can come and have tea in the nursery and I've got a little
gramophone Uncle Reggie gave me for Christmas and it plays "When Father
Papered the Parlour", do you know that song? Ben can sing it and I've
got some books to show you and a picture I did of the battle of Marston
Moor.
subQuotationList:
['Well, I'll tell you. We'll go to church in the morning because I have
to and then we'll go and look at Thunderclap and I'll show you the place
we jump and then you can come with me while I have dinner because I have
it early and afterwards we can go down to Bruton Wood and we needn't
take nanny because it makes her so muddy and you can see where they dug
out a fox in the drain just outside the wood, he nearly got away, and
then you can come and have tea in the nursery and I've got a little
gramophone Uncle Reggie gave me for Christmas and it plays "When Father
Papered the Parlour", do you know that song? Ben can sing it and I've
got some books to show you and a picture I did of the battle of Marston
Moor.']
speaker: John Andrew
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar', 'John Andrew'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar', 'John Andrew'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar', 'John Andrew'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar', 'John Andrew'], ['Nanny'], ['Nanny'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Reggie'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Ben'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar']]]

quoteText:
I think that sounds a lovely day. But don't you think I ought to spend
some time with daddy and mummy and Lady Cockpurse?
subQuotationList: ["I think that sounds a lovely day. But don't you think I ought to spend\nsome time with daddy and mummy and Lady Cockpurse?"]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText:
Oh, _them_... besides, it's all my foot about Lady Cockpurse having a
tail. Please, you _will_ spend the day with me?
subQuotationList: ["Oh, _them_... besides, it's all my foot about Lady Cockpurse having a\ntail. Please, you _will_ spend the day with me?"]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: Well, we'll see.
subQuotationList: ["Well, we'll see."]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: She's gone to church with him. That's a good sign, isn't it?
subQuotationList: ["She's gone to church with him. That's a good sign, isn't it?"]
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

quoteText:
Well, not really, Polly. He likes going alone, or with me. It's the
time he gossips to the village.
subQuotationList: ["Well, not really, Polly. He likes going alone, or with me. It's the\ntime he gossips to the village."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: She won't stop him.
subQuotationList: ["She won't stop him."]
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

quoteText:
I'm afraid you don't understand the old boy altogether. He's much odder
than you'd think.
subQuotationList: ["I'm afraid you don't understand the old boy altogether. He's much odder\nthan you'd think."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: I could see from your sermon that you knew the East, Rector.
subQuotationList: ['I could see from your sermon that you knew the East, Rector.']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: Yes, yes, most of my life.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, yes, most of my life.']
speaker: The Vicar

quoteText: It has an uncanny fascination, hasn't it?
subQuotationList: ["It has an uncanny fascination, hasn't it?"]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText:
Oh, come on, We must go and see
Thunderclap.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, come on,', 'We must go and see\nThunderclap.']
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: Why don't you show Jenny the house?
subQuotationList: ["Why don't you show Jenny the house?"]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Oh yes, _do_.
subQuotationList: ['Oh yes, _do_.']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText:
Brenda's having it done
up.
subQuotationList: ["Brenda's having it done\nup."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Oh, Teddy, what a shame. I do hate seeing things modernized.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, Teddy, what a shame. I do hate seeing things modernized.']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: It isn't a room we used very much.
subQuotationList: ["It isn't a room we used very much."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: No, but still...
subQuotationList: ['No, but still...']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText:
You know, Brenda's been a wonderful friend to me. I
wouldn't say anything against her... but ever since I came here I've
been wondering whether she really understands this beautiful place and
all it means to you.
subQuotationList:
["You know, Brenda's been a wonderful friend to me. I
wouldn't say anything against her... but ever since I came here I've
been wondering whether she really understands this beautiful place and
all it means to you."]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText: Tell me more about your terrible life,
subQuotationList: ['Tell me more about your terrible life,']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
You _are_ shy of talking about yourself, aren't you, Teddy? It's a
mistake, you know, to keep things bottled up. I've been very unhappy
too.
subQuotationList: ["You _are_ shy of talking about yourself, aren't you, Teddy? It's a\nmistake, you know, to keep things bottled up. I've been very unhappy\ntoo."]
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText:
Oh,
there you are, Come on. We're going down
to the woods now. We must hurry, otherwise it will be dark.
subQuotationList: ['Oh,\nthere you are,', "Come on. We're going down\nto the woods now. We must hurry, otherwise it will be dark."]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: Oh, Johnny-boy, must I really? I was just talking to daddy.
subQuotationList: ['Oh, Johnny-boy, must I really? I was just talking to daddy.']
speaker: Jenny Abdul Akbar

quoteText:
_Come on._ It's all arranged. And afterwards you're to be allowed to
have tea with me upstairs.
subQuotationList: ["_Come on._ It's all arranged. And afterwards you're to be allowed to\nhave tea with me upstairs."]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText:
_Tony_, here all alone?
We thought you were with Jenny. What have you done with her?
subQuotationList: ['_Tony_, here all alone?\nWe thought you were with Jenny. What have you done with her?']
speaker: Brenda
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Tony Last'], ['Brenda', 'Polly Cockpurse'], ['Tony Last'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar'], ['Tony Last'], ['Jenny Abdul Akbar']]]

quoteText: John took her off... just in time before I said something rude.
subQuotationList: ['John took her off... just in time before I said something rude.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
Oh dear... well there's only me and Polly in the smoking-room. Come
and have some tea. You look all funny--have you been asleep?
subQuotationList: ["Oh dear... well there's only me and Polly in the smoking-room. Come\nand have some tea. You look all funny--have you been asleep?"]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: We must write it down a failure, definitely.
subQuotationList: ['We must write it down a failure, definitely.']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText:
What _does_ the old boy expect? It isn't as though he was everybody's
money.
subQuotationList: ["What _does_ the old boy expect? It isn't as though he was everybody's\nmoney."]
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

quoteText:
I daresay it would have been all right, if she hadn't got his name
wrong.
subQuotationList: ["I daresay it would have been all right, if she hadn't got his name\nwrong."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText:
Anyway, this lets _you_ out. You've done far more than most wives would
to cheer the old boy up.
subQuotationList: ["Anyway, this lets _you_ out. You've done far more than most wives would\nto cheer the old boy up."]
speaker: Polly Cockpurse

quoteText: Yes, that's certainly true,
subQuotationList: ["Yes, that's certainly true,"]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText:
I shan't be here
next week-end, I'm going to stay with Veronica.
subQuotationList: ["I shan't be here\nnext week-end,", "I'm going to stay with Veronica."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Am I asked?
subQuotationList: ['Am I asked?']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
Well, you _were_, of course, but I refused for you. You know you always
hate staying away.
subQuotationList: ['Well, you _were_, of course, but I refused for you. You know you always\nhate staying away.']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: I wouldn't mind coming.
subQuotationList: ["I wouldn't mind coming."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
Oh, darling, I wish I'd known. Veronica would have loved it so... but
I'm afraid it will be too late now. She's only got a tiny house... to
tell you the truth I didn't think you liked her much.
subQuotationList: ["Oh, darling, I wish I'd known. Veronica would have loved it so... but\nI'm afraid it will be too late now. She's only got a tiny house... to\ntell you the truth I didn't think you liked her much."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: I hated her like hell.
subQuotationList: ['I hated her like hell.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Well, then...?
subQuotationList: ['Well, then...?']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText:
Oh, it doesn't matter. I suppose you must go back on Monday? The hounds
are meeting on Wednesday, you know.
subQuotationList: ["Oh, it doesn't matter. I suppose you must go back on Monday? The hounds\nare meeting on Wednesday, you know."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Are we giving them a lawner?
subQuotationList: ['Are we giving them a lawner?']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Yes, darling, you know we do every year.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, darling, you know we do every year.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: So we do.
subQuotationList: ['So we do.']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: You couldn't stay down till then?
subQuotationList: ["You couldn't stay down till then?"]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
Not possibly, darling. You see if I miss one lecture I get right behind
and can't follow the next. Besides, I am not mad keen to see the
hounds.
subQuotationList: ["Not possibly, darling. You see if I miss one lecture I get right behind\nand can't follow the next. Besides, I am not mad keen to see the\nhounds."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Ben was asking if we'd let John go out.
subQuotationList: ["Ben was asking if we'd let John go out."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Oh, he's far too young.
subQuotationList: ["Oh, he's far too young."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText:
Not to hunt. But I thought he might bring his pony to the meet and ride
with them to the first covert. He'd love it so.
subQuotationList: ["Not to hunt. But I thought he might bring his pony to the meet and ride\nwith them to the first covert. He'd love it so."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Is it quite safe?
subQuotationList: ['Is it quite safe?']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Oh, yes, surely?
subQuotationList: ['Oh, yes, surely?']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Bless his heart, I wish I could be here to see him.
subQuotationList: ['Bless his heart, I wish I could be here to see him.']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Do change your mind.
subQuotationList: ['Do change your mind.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
Oh no, that's quite out of the question. Don't make a thing about it,
Tony.
subQuotationList: ["Oh no, that's quite out of the question. Don't make a thing about it,\nTony."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: The old boy's happy as a lark, He's settling down wonderfully to the new r?gime.
subQuotationList: ["The old boy's happy as a lark,", "He's settling down wonderfully to the new r?gime."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Tony nearly had one through the window,
subQuotationList: ['Tony nearly had one through the window,']
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText: Everything _is_ all right, isn't it?
subQuotationList: ["Everything _is_ all right, isn't it?"]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Yes, of course, darling.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, of course, darling.']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: I get depressed down here all alone and imagine things.
subQuotationList: ['I get depressed down here all alone and imagine things.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
You aren't to _brood_, Tony. You know that's one of the things that
aren't allowed.
subQuotationList: ["You aren't to _brood_, Tony. You know that's one of the things that\naren't allowed."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: I won't brood any more,
subQuotationList: ["I won't brood any more,"]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: And how are the abstruse sciences, Lady Brenda?
subQuotationList: ['And how are the abstruse sciences, Lady Brenda?']
speaker: The Vicar

quoteText: Absorbing.
subQuotationList: ['Absorbing.']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: We shall all be coming to you for advice about our overdrafts.
subQuotationList: ['We shall all be coming to you for advice about our overdrafts.']
speaker: The Vicar

quoteText: Ha, ha.
subQuotationList: ['Ha, ha.']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: And how's Thunderclap?
subQuotationList: ["And how's Thunderclap?"]
speaker: Miss Tendril

quoteText: I'm taking her out hunting on Wednesday,
subQuotationList: ["I'm taking her out hunting on Wednesday,"]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText:
Please God
make there be a good scent. Please God make me see the kill. Please God
don't let me do anything wrong. God bless Ben and Thunderclap. Please
God make me jump an enormous great oxer,
subQuotationList:
["Please God
make there be a good scent. Please God make me see the kill. Please God
don't let me do anything wrong. God bless Ben and Thunderclap. Please
God make me jump an enormous great oxer,"]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText:
We've got the hounds meeting at Hetton on Wednesday. Couldn't you
stay down till then?
subQuotationList: ["We've got the hounds meeting at Hetton on Wednesday. Couldn't you\nstay down till then?"]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Must be back. There's going to be a debate on the Pig Scheme.
subQuotationList: ["Must be back. There's going to be a debate on the Pig Scheme."]
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText:
I wish you'd stay. Look here, why don't you ask that girl down?
Everyone goes to-morrow. You could ring her up, couldn't you?
subQuotationList: ["I wish you'd stay. Look here, why don't you ask that girl down?\nEveryone goes to-morrow. You could ring her up, couldn't you?"]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: I _could_.
subQuotationList: ['I _could_.']
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText:
Would she hate it? She could have Lyonesse--Polly slept there two
week-ends running, so it can't be too uncomfortable.
subQuotationList: ["Would she hate it? She could have Lyonesse--Polly slept there two\nweek-ends running, so it can't be too uncomfortable."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: She'd probably love it. I'll ring up and ask her.
subQuotationList: ["She'd probably love it. I'll ring up and ask her."]
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText:
Why don't you hunt too? There's a chap called Brinkwell who's got some
quite decent hirelings, I believe.
subQuotationList: ["Why don't you hunt too? There's a chap called Brinkwell who's got some\nquite decent hirelings, I believe."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Yes, I might.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, I might.']
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText:
Jock's staying on. He's having the Shameless Blonde down. You don't
mind?
subQuotationList: ["Jock's staying on. He's having the Shameless Blonde down. You don't\nmind?"]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Me? Of course not.
subQuotationList: ['Me? Of course not.']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: This _has_ been a jolly week-end.
subQuotationList: ['This _has_ been a jolly week-end.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: I thought you were enjoying it.
subQuotationList: ['I thought you were enjoying it.']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Just like old times--before the economics began.
subQuotationList: ['Just like old times--before the economics began.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: D'you think Tony knows about Mr Beaver?
subQuotationList: ["D'you think Tony knows about Mr Beaver?"]
speaker: Marjorie

quoteText: Not a thing.
subQuotationList: ['Not a thing.']
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText: I haven't mentioned it to Allan. D'you suppose he knows?
subQuotationList: ["I haven't mentioned it to Allan. D'you suppose he knows?"]
speaker: Marjorie

quoteText: I doubt it.
subQuotationList: ['I doubt it.']
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText: Oh, Jock, how d'you think it'll end?
subQuotationList: ["Oh, Jock, how d'you think it'll end?"]
speaker: Marjorie

quoteText: She'll get bored with Beaver soon enough.
subQuotationList: ["She'll get bored with Beaver soon enough."]
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText:
The trouble is that he doesn't care for her in the least. If he did, it
would soon be over... What an ass she is being.
subQuotationList: ["The trouble is that he doesn't care for her in the least. If he did, it\nwould soon be over... What an ass she is being."]
speaker: Marjorie

quoteText: I should say she was managing it unusually well, if you ask me.
subQuotationList: ['I should say she was managing it unusually well, if you ask me.']
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText:
D'you think Marjorie and
Allan know about Brenda?
subQuotationList: ["D'you think Marjorie and\nAllan know about Brenda?"]
speaker: Unknowable
referringExpression: The other married couple said to each other

quoteText: I'm sure they don't.
subQuotationList: ["I'm sure they don't."]
speaker: Unknowable

quoteText: Tony's as happy as a sandboy, isn't he?
subQuotationList: ["Tony's as happy as a sandboy, isn't he?"]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Full of beans.
subQuotationList: ['Full of beans.']
speaker: Allan

quoteText:
I was getting worried about him... You don't think he's got any idea
about my goings on?
subQuotationList: ["I was getting worried about him... You don't think he's got any idea\nabout my goings on?"]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Lord no. It's the last thing that would come into his head.
subQuotationList: ["Lord no. It's the last thing that would come into his head."]
speaker: Allan

quoteText:
I don't want him to be unhappy, you know... Marjorie's
been frightfully governessy about the whole thing.
subQuotationList: ["I don't want him to be unhappy, you know... Marjorie's\nbeen frightfully governessy about the whole thing."]
speaker: Brenda

quoteText: Has she? I haven't discussed it with her.
subQuotationList: ["Has she? I haven't discussed it with her."]
speaker: Allan

quoteText: How did _you_ hear?
subQuotationList: ['How did _you_ hear?']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText:
My dear girl, until this minute I didn't know you had any goings on.
And I'm not asking any questions about them now.
subQuotationList: ["My dear girl, until this minute I didn't know you had any goings on.\nAnd I'm not asking any questions about them now."]
speaker: Allan

quoteText: Oh... I thought everyone knew.
subQuotationList: ['Oh... I thought everyone knew.']
speaker: Brenda

quoteText:
That's always the trouble with people when they start walking out. They
either think no one knows, or everybody. The truth is that a few people
like Polly and Sybil make a point of finding out about everyone's
private life; the rest of us just aren't interested.
subQuotationList:
["That's always the trouble with people when they start walking out. They
either think no one knows, or everybody. The truth is that a few people
like Polly and Sybil make a point of finding out about everyone's
private life; the rest of us just aren't interested."]
speaker: Allan

quoteText: Oh.
speaker: Brenda

quoteText:
Brenda tried to be confidential about Beaver
this evening.
subQuotationList: ['Brenda tried to be confidential about Beaver\nthis evening.']
speaker: Allan

quoteText: I didn't know you knew.
subQuotationList: ["I didn't know you knew."]
speaker: Marjorie

quoteText:
Oh, I knew all right. But I wasn't going to let her feel important by
talking about it.
subQuotationList: ["Oh, I knew all right. But I wasn't going to let her feel important by\ntalking about it."]
speaker: Allan

quoteText: I couldn't disapprove more of the whole thing. Do you know Beaver?
subQuotationList: ["I couldn't disapprove more of the whole thing. Do you know Beaver?"]
speaker: Marjorie

quoteText: I've seen him about. Anyway, it's her business and Tony's, not ours.
subQuotationList: ["I've seen him about. Anyway, it's her business and Tony's, not ours."]
speaker: Allan

quoteText:
Forty-two minutes, not at all bad with the
wind against me.
subQuotationList: ['Forty-two minutes,', 'not at all bad with the\nwind against me.']
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText:
Are you going to hunt on Wednesday? They're meeting here,
you know.
subQuotationList: ['Are you going to hunt on Wednesday?', "They're meeting here,\nyou know."]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText:
I might go out for half the day, if I can find a horse. It'll be the
first time this year.
subQuotationList: ["I might go out for half the day, if I can find a horse. It'll be the\nfirst time this year."]
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText: It's my first time too.
subQuotationList: ["It's my first time too."]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: We shall both be terribly stiff.
subQuotationList: ['We shall both be terribly stiff.']
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText: You'll have to show me the country.
subQuotationList: ["You'll have to show me the country."]
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText:
I expect they'll draw Bruton Wood first. There's a big fox there, daddy
and I saw him.
subQuotationList: ["I expect they'll draw Bruton Wood first. There's a big fox there, daddy\nand I saw him."]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText:
It's delightful your coming
down. What d'you think of Tony?
subQuotationList: ["It's delightful your coming\ndown. What d'you think of Tony?"]
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText: Is he married to that rather lovely woman we saw at the Caf? de Paris?
subQuotationList: ['Is he married to that rather lovely woman we saw at the Caf? de Paris?']
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText: Yes.
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText: The one you said was in love with that young man?
subQuotationList: ['The one you said was in love with that young man?']
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText: Yes.
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText: Funny of her... What's this one's name again?
subQuotationList: ["Funny of her... What's this one's name again?"]
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText: Tony Last. It's a pretty ghastly house, isn't it?
subQuotationList: ["Tony Last. It's a pretty ghastly house, isn't it?"]
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText: Is it? I never notice houses much.
subQuotationList: ['Is it? I never notice houses much.']
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText:
Don't wait up for me, I shall stay here until it comes out.
It often takes several hours.
subQuotationList: ["Don't wait up for me,", 'I shall stay here until it comes out.\nIt often takes several hours.']
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText: Have you got any pigs at the farm?
subQuotationList: ['Have you got any pigs at the farm?']
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText: Yes.
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Would you mind if I went to see them?
subQuotationList: ['Would you mind if I went to see them?']
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText: Not in the least--but why?
subQuotationList: ['Not in the least--but why?']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
And is there a man who looks after them, who will be able to explain
about them?
subQuotationList: ['And is there a man who looks after them, who will be able to explain\nabout them?']
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText: Yes.
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
Well, I think I'll spend the morning with him. I've got to make a
speech about pigs, fairly soon.
subQuotationList: ["Well, I think I'll spend the morning with him. I've got to make a\nspeech about pigs, fairly soon."]
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText:
I was down
early, and found the men at work stripping the ceiling.
I couldn't resist joining in. I hope you don't mind.
subQuotationList: ['I was down\nearly,', "and found the men at work stripping the ceiling.\nI couldn't resist joining in. I hope you don't mind."]
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText:
If I'm in at the death I expect Colonel Inch will blood
me.
subQuotationList: ["If I'm in at the death I expect Colonel Inch will blood\nme."]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: You won't see any death,
subQuotationList: ["You won't see any death,"]
speaker: Nanny

quoteText: He can ride with them as far as the covert,
subQuotationList: ['He can ride with them as far as the covert,']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
Yes, sir, and there'd be no harm in his stayin' a bit to see hounds
working, would there?
subQuotationList: ["Yes, sir, and there'd be no harm in his stayin' a bit to see hounds\nworking, would there?"]
speaker: Ben

quoteText: No, I suppose not.
subQuotationList: ['No, I suppose not.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
And if he breaks away towards home, there'd be no harm in our following
a bit, if we keeps to the lanes and gates, would there, sir?
subQuotationList: ["And if he breaks away towards home, there'd be no harm in our following\na bit, if we keeps to the lanes and gates, would there, sir?"]
speaker: Ben

quoteText: No, but he's not to stay out more than an hour.
subQuotationList: ["No, but he's not to stay out more than an hour."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
You wouldn't have me take him home with hounds running, would you,
sir?
subQuotationList: ["You wouldn't have me take him home with hounds running, would you,\nsir?"]
speaker: Ben

quoteText: Well, he's got to be in before one.
subQuotationList: ["Well, he's got to be in before one."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: I'll see to that, sir. Don't you worry, my beauty, you'll get a hunt right enough.
subQuotationList: ["I'll see to that, sir. Don't you worry, my beauty,", "you'll get a hunt right enough."]
speaker: Ben

quoteText: Hold on to her, son
subQuotationList: ['Hold on to her, son']
speaker: Ben

quoteText:
I'm afraid I'm riding very badly to-day. D'you think anyone has
noticed?
subQuotationList: ["I'm afraid I'm riding very badly to-day. D'you think anyone has\nnoticed?"]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText:
That's all right, son. You can't keep riding-school manners when you're
hunting.
subQuotationList: ["That's all right, son. You can't keep riding-school manners when you're\nhunting."]
speaker: Ben

quoteText:
I rather like this absurd
horse,
subQuotationList: ['I rather like this absurd\nhorse,']
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText: That girl will come to no good,
subQuotationList: ['That girl will come to no good,']
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText: What's happening, Mr Grant-Menzies?
subQuotationList: ["What's happening, Mr Grant-Menzies?"]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: Hounds are drawing the covert.
subQuotationList: ['Hounds are drawing the covert.']
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText: Oh.
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: Are you enjoying yourself?
subQuotationList: ['Are you enjoying yourself?']
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText: Oh, yes. Thunderclap's terribly fresh. I've never known her like this.
subQuotationList: ["Oh, yes. Thunderclap's terribly fresh. I've never known her like this."]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText:
They're calling hounds
off.
subQuotationList: ["They're calling hounds\noff."]
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText: Does that mean it's a blank?
subQuotationList: ["Does that mean it's a blank?"]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: I'm afraid so.
subQuotationList: ["I'm afraid so."]
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText: I hate this happening in _our_ woods, Looks bad.
subQuotationList: ['I hate this happening in _our_ woods,', 'Looks bad.']
speaker: Ben

quoteText:
D'you think I ought to take the young gentleman home,
sir?
subQuotationList: ["D'you think I ought to take the young gentleman home,\nsir?"]
speaker: Ben

quoteText: What did Mr Last say?
subQuotationList: ['What did Mr Last say?']
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText: He said he could go as far as the covert. He didn't say which, sir.
subQuotationList: ["He said he could go as far as the covert. He didn't say which, sir."]
speaker: Ben

quoteText: I'm afraid it sounds as if he ought to go.
subQuotationList: ["I'm afraid it sounds as if he ought to go."]
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText: _Oh, Mr Menzies!_
subQuotationList: ['_Oh, Mr Menzies!_']
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText: Yes, come along, Master John. You've had enough for to-day.
subQuotationList: ["Yes, come along, Master John. You've had enough for to-day."]
speaker: Ben

quoteText: But I haven't had _any_.
subQuotationList: ["But I haven't had _any_."]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText:
If you come back in good time to-day your dad will be all the more
willing to let you come out another day.
subQuotationList: ['If you come back in good time to-day your dad will be all the more\nwilling to let you come out another day.']
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText:
But there mayn't _be_ another day. The world may come to an end.
_Please_, Ben. _Please_, Mr Menzies.
subQuotationList: ["But there mayn't _be_ another day. The world may come to an end.\n_Please_, Ben. _Please_, Mr Menzies."]
speaker: John Andrew

quoteText:
It is a shame they shouldn't have found, He's been looking
forward to it.
subQuotationList: ["It is a shame they shouldn't have found,", "He's been looking\nforward to it."]
speaker: Ben

quoteText: Still, I think Mr Last would want him to go back,
subQuotationList: ['Still, I think Mr Last would want him to go back,']
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText:
Look, Here comes Miss Ripon on that nappy
bay. Seems as if she's going in, too. Had a fall by the looks of her.
subQuotationList: ['Look,', "Here comes Miss Ripon on that nappy\nbay. Seems as if she's going in, too. Had a fall by the looks of her."]
speaker: Ben

quoteText:
I'm taking him away, I can't do anything with him this morning. I thought perhaps Mr Last would let me
come up to the house and telephone for the car. I don't feel like
hacking him home in his present state. I can't think what's come over
him, He was out on Saturday. I've never known him
like this before.
subQuotationList:
["I'm taking him away,", "I can't do anything with him this morning.", "I thought perhaps Mr Last would let me
come up to the house and telephone for the car. I don't feel like
hacking him home in his present state. I can't think what's come over
him,", "He was out on Saturday. I've never known him
like this before."]
speaker: Miss Ripon

quoteText: He wants a man up,
subQuotationList: ['He wants a man up,']
speaker: Ben

quoteText:
Oh, he's no better with the groom, and daddy won't go near him, At least... I mean... I don't
think that they'd be any better with him in this state.
subQuotationList: ["Oh, he's no better with the groom, and daddy won't go near him,", "At least... I mean... I don't\nthink that they'd be any better with him in this state."]
speaker: Miss Ripon

quoteText:
Let me go first, Miss. He'll follow. Don't hold too hard on
his mouth and just give him a tap.
subQuotationList: ["Let me go first, Miss. He'll follow. Don't hold too hard on\nhis mouth and just give him a tap."]
speaker: Ben

quoteText: Take a hold of him, Miss. Use your whip,
subQuotationList: ['Take a hold of him, Miss. Use your whip,']
speaker: Ben

quoteText: The boy's down.
subQuotationList: ["The boy's down."]
speaker: Miss Ripon

quoteText:
It's the most appalling thing, What on
earth are we going to say to Tony?
subQuotationList: ["It's the most appalling thing,", 'What on\nearth are we going to say to Tony?']
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText: I'm the last person to have about on an occasion like this,
subQuotationList: ["I'm the last person to have about on an occasion like this,"]
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText:
Killed instantly, Took it full on the base of the skull.
Very sad, awfully fond of the kid. No one to blame, though.
subQuotationList: ['Killed instantly,', 'Took it full on the base of the skull.\nVery sad, awfully fond of the kid. No one to blame, though.']
speaker: The Doctor

quoteText: It wasn't the kid's fault,
subQuotationList: ["It wasn't the kid's fault,"]
speaker: Ben

quoteText: It wasn't anyone's fault,
subQuotationList: ["It wasn't anyone's fault,"]
speaker: Unknowable

quoteText: He'd had a lousy day, too, poor little bastard,
subQuotationList: ["He'd had a lousy day, too, poor little bastard,"]
speaker: Ben

quoteText: If it was anyone's fault it was Mr Grant-Menzies making him go in.
subQuotationList: ["If it was anyone's fault it was Mr Grant-Menzies making him go in."]
speaker: Ben

quoteText: It wasn't anyone's fault,
subQuotationList: ["It wasn't anyone's fault,"]
speaker: Unknowable

quoteText: We've got to tell Brenda.
subQuotationList: ["We've got to tell Brenda."]
speaker: Tony Last
referringExpression: he said when Jock came in was

quoteText: D'you know where to get her?
subQuotationList: ["D'you know where to get her?"]
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText:
She's probably at that school... But we can't tell her over the
telephone... Anyway, Ambrose has tried there and the flat but he can't
get through... What on earth are we going to say to her?
subQuotationList: ["She's probably at that school... But we can't tell her over the\ntelephone... Anyway, Ambrose has tried there and the flat but he can't\nget through... What on earth are we going to say to her?"]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
You
weren't anywhere near, were you?
subQuotationList: ["You\nweren't anywhere near, were you?"]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: No, we'd gone on to another covert.
subQuotationList: ["No, we'd gone on to another covert."]
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText:
That niece of Mr Tendril's told me first... then we met them coming
up, and Ben told me all that happened... It's awful for the girl.
subQuotationList: ["That niece of Mr Tendril's told me first... then we met them coming\nup, and Ben told me all that happened... It's awful for the girl."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Miss Ripon?
subQuotationList: ['Miss Ripon?']
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText:
Yes, she's just left... she had a nasty fall too, just after. Her
horse slipped up in the village... she was in a terrible state, poor
child, what with that and... John. She didn't know she'd hurt him until
quite a time afterwards... she was in the chemist's shop having a
bandage put on her head, when they told her. She cut it falling. She was
in a terrible state. I sent her back in the car... it wasn't her
fault.
subQuotationList:
["Yes, she's just left... she had a nasty fall too, just after. Her
horse slipped up in the village... she was in a terrible state, poor
child, what with that and... John. She didn't know she'd hurt him until
quite a time afterwards... she was in the chemist's shop having a
bandage put on her head, when they told her. She cut it falling. She was
in a terrible state. I sent her back in the car... it wasn't her
fault."]
speaker: Tony Last
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['John Andrew'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['John Andrew'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon']]]

quoteText: No, it wasn't anybody's fault. It just happened.
subQuotationList: ["No, it wasn't anybody's fault. It just happened."]
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText:
That's it, It just happened... how are we going to tell
Brenda?
subQuotationList: ["That's it,", 'It just happened... how are we going to tell\nBrenda?']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: One of us will have to go up.
subQuotationList: ['One of us will have to go up.']
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText:
Yes... I think I shall have to stay here. I don't know why really,
but there will be things to see to. It's an awful thing to ask anyone
to do...
subQuotationList: ["Yes... I think I shall have to stay here. I don't know why really,\nbut there will be things to see to. It's an awful thing to ask anyone\nto do..."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: I'll go,
subQuotationList: ["I'll go,"]
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText:
There'll be things to see to there... there's got to be an inquest the
doctor says. It's purely formal, of course, but it will be ghastly for
that Ripon girl. She'll have to give evidence... she was in a terrible
state. I hope I was all right to her. They'd just brought John in and I
was rather muddled. She looked awful. I believe her father's bloody to
her... I wish Brenda had been here. She's so good with everyone. I get
in a muddle.
subQuotationList:
["There'll be things to see to there... there's got to be an inquest the
doctor says. It's purely formal, of course, but it will be ghastly for
that Ripon girl. She'll have to give evidence... she was in a terrible
state. I hope I was all right to her. They'd just brought John in and I
was rather muddled. She looked awful. I believe her father's bloody to
her... I wish Brenda had been here. She's so good with everyone. I get
in a muddle."]
speaker: Tony Last
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['John Andrew'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Brenda'], ['Brenda']]]

quoteText:
Can you really face going up
and seeing Brenda?
subQuotationList: ['Can you really face going up\nand seeing Brenda?']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Yes, I'll go,
subQuotationList: ["Yes, I'll go,"]
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText: Colonel Inch has been here, I talked to him. He wanted to give you his sympathy.
subQuotationList: ['Colonel Inch has been here,', 'I talked to him. He wanted to give you his sympathy.']
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText: Is he still here?
subQuotationList: ['Is he still here?']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
No, I told him you'd probably prefer to be left alone. He thought you'd
be glad to hear he stopped the hunt.
subQuotationList: ["No, I told him you'd probably prefer to be left alone. He thought you'd\nbe glad to hear he stopped the hunt."]
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText: Nice of him to come... Were you having a good day?
subQuotationList: ['Nice of him to come... Were you having a good day?']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: No.
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText:
I'm sorry. We saw a fox in Bruton Wood last week. John and I... Jock's
going up to London to fetch Brenda.
subQuotationList: ["I'm sorry. We saw a fox in Bruton Wood last week. John and I... Jock's\ngoing up to London to fetch Brenda."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: I'll take him in the aeroplane. It'll be quicker.
subQuotationList: ["I'll take him in the aeroplane. It'll be quicker."]
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText: Yes, that will be quicker.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, that will be quicker.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: I'll go and change now. I won't be ten minutes.
subQuotationList: ["I'll go and change now. I won't be ten minutes."]
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText: I'll change, too,
subQuotationList: ["I'll change, too,"]
speaker: Jock Grant-Menzies

quoteText:
Will you tell Mr Ambrose that Mrs Rattery is leaving to-day. She is
flying up with Mr Grant-Menzies. Her ladyship will probably be coming by
the evening train.
subQuotationList: ['Will you tell Mr Ambrose that Mrs Rattery is leaving to-day. She is\nflying up with Mr Grant-Menzies. Her ladyship will probably be coming by\nthe evening train.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Very good, sir.
subQuotationList: ['Very good, sir.']
speaker: The Footman

quoteText:
They had better have some luncheon before they go. I will have it with
them... And will you put a call through to Colonel Inch and thank him
for coming? Say I will write. And to Mr Ripon's to enquire how Miss
Ripon is? And to the vicarage and ask Mr Tendril if I can see him this
evening? He's not here still?
subQuotationList:
["They had better have some luncheon before they go. I will have it with
them... And will you put a call through to Colonel Inch and thank him
for coming? Say I will write. And to Mr Ripon's to enquire how Miss
Ripon is? And to the vicarage and ask Mr Tendril if I can see him this
evening? He's not here still?"]
speaker: Tony Last
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Jock Grant-Menzies'], ['Jock Grant-Menzies'], ['Mrs Rattery', 'Jock Grant-Menzies'], ['The Footman'], ['Colonel Inch'], ['Colonel Inch'], ['Mr Ripon'], ['Miss Ripon'], ['Mr Tendril'], ['Mr Tendril'], ['Mr Tendril']]]

quoteText: No, sir, he left a few minutes ago.
subQuotationList: ['No, sir, he left a few minutes ago.']
speaker: The Footman

quoteText: Tell him I shall have to discuss arrangements with him.
subQuotationList: ['Tell him I shall have to discuss arrangements with him.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Very good, sir.
subQuotationList: ['Very good, sir.']
speaker: The Footman

quoteText: They're just getting luncheon.
subQuotationList: ["They're just getting luncheon."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: We shan't want any, You forget we were going hunting.
subQuotationList: ["We shan't want any,", 'You forget we were going hunting.']
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText:
Better have something, It's awful for Jock,
having to tell Brenda. I wonder how long it will be before she arrives.
subQuotationList: ['Better have something,', "It's awful for Jock,\nhaving to tell Brenda. I wonder how long it will be before she arrives."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: What are you going to do while you're waiting?
subQuotationList: ["What are you going to do while you're waiting?"]
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText: I don't know. I suppose there will be things to see to.
subQuotationList: ["I don't know. I suppose there will be things to see to."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
Look here, Jock had better go up by car. I'll stay
here until Lady Brenda comes.
subQuotationList: ['Look here,', "Jock had better go up by car. I'll stay\nhere until Lady Brenda comes."]
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText: It would be awful for you.
subQuotationList: ['It would be awful for you.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: No, I'll stay.
subQuotationList: ["No, I'll stay."]
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText:
I suppose it's ridiculous of me, but I wish you would... I
mean, won't it be awful for you? I am all in a muddle. It's so hard to
believe yet that it really happened.
subQuotationList: ["I suppose it's ridiculous of me, but I wish you would... I\nmean, won't it be awful for you? I am all in a muddle. It's so hard to\nbelieve yet that it really happened."]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: It happened all right.
subQuotationList: ['It happened all right.']
speaker: Mrs. Rattery

quoteText: Mr Grant-Menzies is going up in his car. He may be back to-night, Mrs Rattery is waiting until her ladyship arrives.
subQuotationList: ['Mr Grant-Menzies is going up in his car. He may be back to-night,', 'Mrs Rattery is waiting until her ladyship arrives.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText:
Very good, sir. And Colonel Inch wanted to know whether you would care
to have the huntsmen blow "Gone to ground" at the funeral.
subQuotationList: ['Very good, sir. And Colonel Inch wanted to know whether you would care\nto have the huntsmen blow "Gone to ground" at the funeral.']
speaker: The Footman

quoteText: Say that I'll write to him,
subQuotationList: ["Say that I'll write to him,"]
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: An atrocious suggestion.
subQuotationList: ['An atrocious suggestion.']
speaker: Tony Last

quoteText: Oh, I don't know. He's very anxious to be helpful.
subQuotationList: ["Oh, I don't know. He's very anxious to be helpful."]
speaker: Mrs. Rattery
